name: Brighton Beach Sunrise Triptych | Landscapes
description:
This is one of a pair of Triptychs exploring the nature of portrait and landscape photographic forms.

All of the images were captured one morning after I had been completely unable to sleep, after tossing and turning some hours, with the edge of sunrise colouring the sky. I got up and walked to the beach to photograph the sunrise and any other things I found along the way. It was a beautiful morning, swimmers in the sea, the town quiet, and a lone man intently detecting along the tide-line. The colours of the morning were incredible, and made me contemplate just how much I had been missing living in Brighton not making my way down to the shore for sunrises routine.

These images are slices (to take a turn of phrase from @DuanesWorldArt) of my window into the world the 16th of June sunrise morning 2021.

For this I am taking an idea from @wgm_v for Triptychs in three parts, collect all three parts to redeem the Triptych. These however are all 1/1s and do not require burning to claim.

This also happened to be the last morning this camera took photographs, and the final shot I could ever take on it I will mint and drop to whoever finds themselves in possession of all of these images.

Collect all three to receive the accompanying Triptych | Landscapes: Taking Wing, Detectorist, Seagulls.

| 8755x3862px | Canon 400D and Lightroom | Photographed 16th June, 2021 06:08-06:13, Brighton Beach, Brighton, East Sussex |
